gurmukhi: kwnH ko sIs invwie sBY sur Awies lY cl Dwm gey hYN ]goibMd nwm DrXo hir ko ieh qY mn AwnMd Xwd Bey hYN ]
transliteration: Kaahn Ko Sees Nivaae Sabhai Sur Aais Lai Chal Dhaam Gad Hain|| Gobind Naam Daryo Har(i) Ko Eh Tai Man Aanand Yaad Bhae Hain||
translation: All the gods, taking permission of Krishna, bowed their heads and went back to their abodes; in their delight, they have named Krishna as ‘Govind’;

gurmukhi: rwq pry cil kY Bgvwn su fyrn Awpn bIc Aey hYN ]pRwq Bey jg ky idKby khu kIn su suMdr Kyl ney hYN ]408]
transliteration: Raat Dare Chal Kai Bhagvaan Su Deran Aapan Beech Ae Hain|| Prat Bhae Jag Ke Dikh Be Kaudh Keen Su Soundar Khel Nae Hain||408||
translation: When the night fell, Krishna also returned to his home; early next morning, he prepared for the new and elegant sport for his amorous play for the world.408.

gurmukhi: ieiq sRI bicqR nwtk gRMQy kiRSnwvqwry ieMdR BUl bKSwvn nwm brnnM ]
transliteration: It(i) Sribachitra Naatak Granthe Krishnaavatdare Indra Bhool Bakhshaavan Naam Barnanan||
translation: End of the description of “The Request of Indra for Forgiveness” in Krishna Avatara in Bachittar Natak.

gurmukhi: AQ nMd ko brn bwND kir lY gey ]
transliteration: Ath Nand Ko Baran Baandh Kar(i) Lai Gad||
translation: Now begins the description of the arrest of Nand by Varuna

gurmukhi: ins eyk dÍwds ky hir qwq clXo jmnw mih nwvn kwjY ]Awie prXo jl mY brunM gj kop ghXo sB jor smwjY ]
transliteration: Nis Ek Dvaadas Ke Har(i) Taat Chadyo Jamnaa Maih Naavan Kaajai|| Ooe Daryo Jal Mai Barounan Gad Kop Gadyo Sabh Jor Samaajai||
translation: On the twelfth lunar night, the father of Krishna went to take a bath in Yamuna; he took off his clothes and entered the water; the attendants of Varuna got infuriated;

gurmukhi: bwl clY sMg lY brunM pih kwnHr ky ibn hI kuip gwjY ]jwie kY TwiF krXo jb hI phcwn lXo drIAwvn rwjY ]409]
transliteration: Baal Chalai San Lai Barounan Pah(i) Kaahnar Ke Bin Hikoup(i) Gadjai|| Jaae Kai Thaadh(i) Daryo Jab Hipahhchaan Layo Dareeaavan Raajai||409||
translation: They arrested Nand and proceeded to take him to Varuna, thundering in rage and when they presented him before Varuna, he was recognized by Varuna, the king of the river.409.

gurmukhi: nMd ibnw pur suMn BXo sB hI iml kY hir jI pih Awey ]Awie pRnwm kry pr pwien nMd qiRXwidk qy iGiGAwey ]
transliteration: Nand Binaa Sounn Bhayo Sabh Himil Kai Har(i) Jipah(i) Aae|| Ooe Pranaam Dare Par Paain Nand Triyaadik Te Ghighiaae||
translation: In the absence of Nand, the whole city was deserted; all the residents went together to meet Krishna; all of them bowed before him and touched his feet and all the women and others beseeched him earnestly;

gurmukhi: kY bhu BwNqn so ibnqI kir kY kiRSnw Bgvwn irJwey ]mo piq Awj gey auT kY hm FUMF rhy khUMAY nhI pwey ]410]
transliteration: Kai Bahu Bhaantan So Bintikar(i) Kai Krishnaa Bhagvaan Rijhaae||mo Pat(i) Aaj Gad Outh Kai Ham Dhoondh Rahe Kahoonai Nahipaae||410||
translation: They prayed before him in many ways and pleased him; they said, “We have tried to find out Nand (at many places), but have not been able to locate him.”410.

gurmukhi: qwq khXo his kY jsuDw pih qwq ilAwvn kO hm jYhoN ]swq AkwS pqwl su swqih jwie jhI qh jwhI qy lXY hoN ]
transliteration: Taat Kahyo Has(i) Kai Jasudhaa Pah(i) Taat Liaavan Kau Ham Jaihon|| Saat Akaadh Pataal Su Saatah(i) Jaae Jahitah Jaahite Lyai Hon||
translation: Krishna said smilingly to Yashoda, “I shall go to bring my father and bring him back, searching all the seven skies and seven nether-worlds, wherever he is;
